member.name: M:atcData.frmSelectData.lstCriteria_KeyDownGrid(atcControls.atcGrid,System.Windows.Forms.KeyEventArgs)
member.summary: Scroll list to show first item whose beginning matches what the user is typing
member.remarks: Typing more than one character in a row is supported. If an item is not found that starts with the multiple typed characters, search is reset to find an item starting with just the most recently typed character. Pressing a key for a non-printable character (for example Backspace) resets search.

member.name: M:atcData.atcDataPlugin.#ctor
member.summary: create a new atcDataPlugin

member.name: P:atcData.atcDataPlugin.Name
member.summary: String that appears in the MapWindow Plug-ins menu to identify this plug-in.
member.requirements: Must be overridden in inheriting class to return something unique or plugin will not load.

member.name: P:atcData.atcDataPlugin.Author
member.summary: A company name, individual, or organization name.

member.name: P:atcData.atcDataPlugin.Category
member.summary: Groups related of plugins together in the UI
member.remarks: Suggested categories include "File", "Computation", and "Download"

member.name: P:atcData.atcDataPlugin.Description
member.summary: Longer version of Name with room to expand acronyms
member.remarks: Appears in the plug-ins dialog box when a user selects this plug-in.

member.name: P:atcData.atcDataPlugin.BuildDate
member.summary: Date plug-in was built.
member.remarks: Either return a string of a hard-coded date such as "January 1, 2003" or dynamically obtain the build date of the assembly.

member.name: P:atcData.atcDataPlugin.Version
member.remarks:
Can either return a hard-coded string such as "1.0.0.1" or use
GetVersionInfo to dynamically return the version number from the assembly itself.
member.summary: Version number of the plug-in

member.name: M:atcData.atcDataPlugin.Initialize(MapWindow.Interfaces.IMapWin,System.Int32)
member.summary: Fired when the plugin is loaded (by the plug-in dialog, the plugins menu, or at program start).
member.remarks:
A good time to add buttons to the tool bar or menu items to the menu.
Save a reference to the IMapWin that is passed for later access to MapWindow.

member.name: M:atcData.atcDataPlugin.Terminate
member.summary: Fired when the plugin is unloaded (by the plugin dialog, the plugins menu, or on program exit).
member.remarks:
Remove any buttons from the tool bar or menu items from the menu that this plugin added.
If you don't do this, then you will leave dangling menus and buttons that don't do anything.

member.name: M:atcData.atcDataPlugin.ItemClicked(System.String,System.Boolean@)
member.summary: Fires when a menu item or toolbar button is clicked. If this plugin added a button or menu on the Initialize event, this is where those events are handled.

member.name: M:atcData.atcDataPlugin.LayerRemoved(System.Int32)
member.summary:
Fires when the user removes a layer from MapWindow.
Useful if this plug-in depends on a particular layer being present, or if it keeps an internal list of layers.

member.name: M:atcData.atcDataPlugin.LayersAdded(MapWindow.Interfaces.Layer[])
member.summary: Fires when the user adds a layer to MapWindow. Useful in the same cases as LayerRemoved

member.name: M:atcData.atcDataPlugin.LayersCleared
member.summary: Fires when the user clears all of the layers from MapWindow.
member.remarks: Useful in the same cases as LayerRemoved

member.name: M:atcData.atcDataPlugin.LayerSelected(System.Int32)
member.summary: Fires when a user selects a layer in the legend.

member.name: M:atcData.atcDataPlugin.LegendDoubleClick(System.Int32,MapWindow.Interfaces.ClickLocation,System.Boolean@)
member.summary: Fires when a user double-clicks a layer in the legend.

member.name: M:atcData.atcDataPlugin.LegendMouseDown(System.Int32,System.Int32,MapWindow.Interfaces.ClickLocation,System.Boolean@)
member.summary: Fires when a user holds a mouse button down in the legend.

member.name: M:atcData.atcDataPlugin.LegendMouseUp(System.Int32,System.Int32,MapWindow.Interfaces.ClickLocation,System.Boolean@)
member.summary: Fires when a user releases a mouse button in the legend.

member.name: M:atcData.atcDataPlugin.MapDragFinished(System.Drawing.Rectangle,System.Boolean@)
member.summary: Fires after a user draws a box with the mouse on the map
member.remarks: Bounds specifies the box that was "drawn"

member.name: M:atcData.atcDataPlugin.MapExtentsChanged
member.summary: Fires any time there is a zoom or pan that changes the map extents.

member.name: M:atcData.atcDataPlugin.MapMouseDown(System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Boolean@)
member.summary: Fires when the user presses a mouse button on the map. The x and y are screen coordinates in pixels.
member.remarks: If map coordinates are needed, use g_MapWin.View.PixelToProj() where g_MapWin is a saved reference to MapWin from Initialize

member.name: M:atcData.atcDataPlugin.MapMouseMove(System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Boolean@)
member.summary: Fires when the user moves the mouse over the map. See MapMouseDown.

member.name: M:atcData.atcDataPlugin.MapMouseUp(System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Boolean@)
member.summary: Fires when the user releases a mouse button over the map. See MapMouseDown.

member.name: M:atcData.atcDataPlugin.Message(System.String,System.Boolean@)
member.summary: Plugins can communicate with each other using Messages. If a message is sent then this event fires.
member.remarks: Set Handled=True to stop the message from being sent to any more plugins.

member.name: M:atcData.atcDataPlugin.ProjectLoading(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Fires when a project is opened in MapWindow.
member.param: file name including path of the project that was opened.
contains the string of data that is connected to this plugin and was stored in the project in a ProjectSaving event.

member.name: M:atcData.atcDataPlugin.ProjectSaving(System.String,System.String@)
member.summary: Fires when a project is saved in MapWindow.
member.param: file name including path of the project that is being saved.

be set to any string of data that is connected to this plugin
which should be stored in the project file.

member.name: M:atcData.atcDataPlugin.ShapesSelected(System.Int32,MapWindow.Interfaces.SelectInfo)
member.summary: Fires when the user selects one or more shapes using the select tool in MapWindow.
member.param: Layer handle for the shapefile on which shapes were selected.
holds information about the shapes that were selected.

member.name: P:atcData.atcDataPlugin.SerialNumber
member.summary: Deprecated - do NOT use
member.remarks: Leftover part of IPlugin interface no longer in use

member.name: M:atcData.atcDataPlugin.NewOne
member.summary: Calls the version of New with no arguments.
member.remarks: Inheriting classes that have no New w/o arguments must override.

summary.para: Base class for plugins that can read, write, manipulate, or display atcData

remarks.para: This class implements MapWindow.Interfaces.IPlugin so it can be loaded by the MapWindow plugin code
Name must be overridden with a unique name for a child class to be loaded as a plugin. Others may be overridden if desired.

member.remarks: Should only be set by inheriting class, only during Open or Save

member.name: P:atcData.atcDataSource.Filter

member.name: M:atcData.modTimeseriesMath.FindDateAtOrAfter(System.Double[],System.Double,System.Int32)
member.summary: Search through an array of dates looking for a date
member.param: Index of data to begin search at (default is 0)
member.returns: Index of first date on or after date searched for

member.name: M:atcData.modTimeseriesMath.SubsetByDate(atcData.atcTimeseries,System.Double,System.Double,atcData.atcTimeseriesSource)
member.summary: Creates a timeseries copied from orginal that only contains dates within specifed range
member.param: Data Source to assign to newly created subset timeseries, can be 'Nothing'
member.remarks: if aDataSource is 'Nothing' only a reference to a new timeseries is returned

member.name: M:atcData.modTimeseriesMath.SubsetByDateBoundary(atcData.atcTimeseries,System.Int32,System.Int32,atcData.atcTimeseriesSource,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Trim a timeseries if needed to make it start and end at the desired year boundary. Useful when complete calendar or water years are needed.
member.param: Month containing first value of the year
Day containing first value of the year
Data Source to assign to newly created subset timeseries, can be Nothing
Optional first year of data to include in subset
Optional last year of data to include in subset
Optional month containing last value of the year
Optional day containing last value of the year
member.remarks: If omitted or zero, aFirstYear or aLastYear will not be used to limit the subset. If omitted or zero, aEndMonth/aEndDay will default to the day before aStartMonth/aStartDay.

member.name: M:atcData.modTimeseriesMath.CopyBaseAttributes(atcData.atcTimeseries,atcData.atcTimeseries,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Copy any attributes that copies inherit from aFromDataSet into aToDataSet
member.param: Number of values to copy value attributes of
Start index for copying value attributes from
Start index for copying value attributes to
member.remarks: Copies only general attributes if aNumValues is omitted or is less than 1, Also copies value attributes if aNumValues > 0

member.name: M:atcData.modTimeseriesMath.MergeTimeseries(atcData.atcTimeseriesGroup,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Merge a group of atcTimeseries
member.param: True to skip missing values, False to include missing values in result
member.returns: atcTimeseries containing all unique dates from the group
member.remarks: Each atcTimeseries in aGroup is assumed to be in order by date within itself. If duplicate dates exist in aGroup, some values will be left out of result.

member.name: M:atcData.modTimeseriesMath.MergeDates(atcData.atcTimeseriesGroup,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Merge the dates from a group of atcTimeseries
member.param: Group of atcTimeseries to merge the dates of
True to skip missing values, False to include missing values in result
member.returns: atcTimeseries containing all unique dates from the group
member.remarks: Each atcTimeseries in aGroup is assumed to be in order by date within itself.

member.name: M:atcData.modTimeseriesMath.FillValues(atcData.atcTimeseries,atcUtility.modDate.atcTimeUnit,System.Int64,System.Double,System.Double,System.Double,atcData.atcTimeseriesSource)
member.summary: Fill values in constant interval timeseries with specified values.
member.param: Value to Fill data gaps with.
member.remarks: Assumes dates are at the end of each value's interval and that the 0th position in the Dates array is the beginning of the first interval.

member.name: M:atcData.modTimeseriesMath.FillMissingByInterpolation(atcData.atcTimeseries,System.Double,System.Collections.ArrayList,System.Double)
member.summary: Fill missing periods in a timeseries using interpolation
member.param: Max span, in Julian Days, over which interpolation is allowed
Array returning length of each missing period filled
member.returns: atcTimeseries clone of original timeseries along with interpolated values

member.name: M:atcData.modTimeseriesMath.Aggregate(atcData.atcTimeseries,atcUtility.modDate.atcTimeUnit,System.Int32,atcUtility.modDate.atcTran,atcData.atcTimeseriesSource)
member.summary: Aggregate specified timeseries to interval specified
member.param: Time step to aggregate to (in time units
Data Source to assign to newly created subset timeseries, can be Nothing

member.name: M:atcData.modTimeseriesMath.NewDates(System.Double,System.Double,atcUtility.modDate.atcTimeUnit,System.Int32)
member.summary: Build a constant-interval date array
member.param: Time Step (number of Time Units per step)

member.name: M:atcData.modTimeseriesMath.BinarySearchFirstGreaterDoubleArrayList(System.Collections.ArrayList,System.Double)
member.summary: Binary search through an ArrayList containing Double values sorted in ascending order
member.returns: Return the index of the first value >= aValue
member.remarks: Returns aArray.Count if aArray contains no values >= aValue

member.name: M:atcData.modTimeseriesMath.ComputeRanks(atcData.atcTimeseries,System.Boolean,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Assign integers from one to the number of non-missing values to the Rank value attributes
member.param: If True, lowest value gets rank of 1, if False, highest value gets rank of 1

If True, identical values get the same rank and next rank is not assigned, ex: (5, 5, 9, 7) get ranks (1, 1, 4, 3) If False and aLowToHigh is False, earlier value gets lower rank (5, 5, 9, 7) get ranks (1, 2, 4, 3) If False and aLowToHigh is True, later value gets lower rank (5, 5, 9, 7) get ranks (2, 1, 4, 3)

member.name: M:atcData.modTimeseriesMath.ComputePercentileSum(atcData.atcTimeseries,System.Double)
member.summary: Compute sum value at specified percentile of specified timeseries
member.remarks: Computed percentile stored in attribute within timeseries with attribute name built from percentile value prefixed with '%Sum'

member.name: M:atcData.modTimeseriesMath.ComputePercentile(atcData.atcTimeseries,System.Double)
member.summary: Compute value at specified percentile of specified timeseries
member.remarks: Computed percentile stored in attribute within timeseries with attribute name built from percentile value prefixed with '%'

member.name: M:atcData.modTimeseriesMath.FitLine(atcData.atcTimeseries,atcData.atcTimeseries,System.Double@,System.Double@,System.Double@)
member.summary: fit a line through a set of data points using least squares regression.
member.remarks: from fortran-newaqt-FITLIN

member.name: M:atcData.atcDataManager.DataSourceBySpecification(System.String)
member.summary: Get a data source that is already open by its specification
member.param: The file name for file-based data sources
member.returns: the data source if it is already open, Nothing if it is not open
member.remarks: Searching for a match is not case sensitive but it can be fooled if two different specifications refer to the same file Always use consistent full path of files Use OpenDataSource to open one that is not yet open

member.name: M:atcData.atcDataManager.DatasetsAtMapSelectedLocations
member.summary: Return the currently loaded datasets whose Location attribute matches a currently selected shape on the map

member.name: M:atcData.atcDataManager.MapLayerLocationField(atcUtility.atcTableDBF)
member.summary: Return the one-based location field index in the layer DBF
member.param: Table to find a location field in. Contains one row per shape.
member.remarks: Uses file layers.dbf to determine which field in the layer's dbf contains locations. Base layer file name is in first column, location field index is in fourth column. If layers.dbf is not found or layer is not found in it, scans aLayerDBF for a field named in pLikelyShapeLocationFieldNames.

member.name: M:atcData.atcDataManager.MapSelectedLocations
member.summary: Returns list of locations (as string) of currently selected shapes on the map Returns empty list if there is no dbf for the current layer or if location field cannot be determined

member.name: T:atcData.atcAttributeDefinition

summary.para: Detailed type information about an attribute value

member.name: M:atcData.atcDataGroup.FindData(System.String,System.String,System.Int32)
member.summary: Return a subset of this atcDataGroup containing only the atcDataSets where the named attribute has the given value
member.param: Value that given attribute must have to include dataset in group returned
Optional limit of how many data sets to return, default of 0 means there is no limit
member.remarks: search for value is not case sensitive

member.name: M:atcData.atcDataGroup.FindData(System.String,atcUtility.atcCollection,System.Int32)
member.summary: Return a subset of this atcDataGroup containing only the atcDataSets where the named attribute has one of the given values
member.param: Acceptable values for the given attribute to include dataset in group returned
Optional limit of how many data sets to return, default of 0 means there is no limit
member.remarks: search for value is not case sensitive

Optional string to use if a dataset does not have a value for the given attribute

Events are defined to allow different displays to remain synchronized
